results.title: Metformin use and the risk of anal intraepithelial neoplasia in type II diabetic patients.
results.text_hl: This relationship suggests that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ could potentially play a protective role against @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@AIN@@@.

results.title: The addition of metformin to progestin therapy in the fertility-sparing treatment of women with atypical hyperplasia/endometrial intraepithelial neoplasia or endometrial cancer: Little impact on response and low live-birth rates.
results.text_hl: The addition of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ to progestin therapy in the fertility-sparing treatment of @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Endometrial_Hyperplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D004714 @@@atypical hyperplasia@@@/@<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@endometrial intraepithelial neoplasia@@@ or @DISEASE_Endometrial_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D016889 @@@endometrial cancer@@@: Little impact on response and low live-birth rates.

results.title: Metformin suppresses cancer initiation and progression in genetic mouse models of pancreatic cancer
results.text_hl: However, following @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment, the percentage of early and late @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@mPanIN lesions@@@ was decreased (Fig. 2e).

results.title: Antidiabetic Drug Metformin Prevents Progression of Pancreatic Cancer by Targeting in Part Cancer Stem Cells and mTOR Signaling.
results.text_hl: We tested the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@PanIN@@@) and their progression to @DISEASE_Carcinoma_Pancreatic_Ductal @DISEASE_MESH:D021441 @@@PDAC@@@ in p48Cre/+.LSL-KrasG12D/+ transgenic @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

results.title: Metformin alters the duodenal microbiome and decreases the incidence of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma promoted by diet-induced obesity.
results.journal: Am J Physiol Gastrointest Liver Physiol
results.text_hl: One potential way that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ can affect the host is through alterations in the gut microbiome.

citations.NLM: Dong TS, Chang HH, Hauer M, Lagishetty V, Katzka W, Rozengurt E, Jacobs JP, Eibl G.
